official-title.#text:
To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
		  to provide for participation in the Exchange of the President, Vice President,
		  Members of Congress, political appointees, and Congressional
		  staff.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on
committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

committee-name.#tail:
, for
			 a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Participation of
			 President, Vice President, Members of Congress, political appointees, and
			 Congressional staff in the exchange

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended to read as
			 follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and
			 Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1312/ss:d/p:3/sp:D

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, each political appointee, each Member of Congress, and each
				Congressional employee shall be treated as a qualified individual entitled to
				the right under this paragraph to enroll in a qualified health plan in the
				individual market offered through an Exchange in the State in which the
				individual resides; and

,
				any political appointee, any Member of Congress, and any Congressional employee
				may be paid only to the issuer of a qualified health plan in which the
				individual enrolled through such Exchange and not to the issuer of a plan
				offered through the Federal employees health benefit program under such
				chapter.

text.#text:
any employer
				contribution under such chapter on behalf of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or any provision of this title—

, each political appointee, each Member of Congress, and each
				Congressional employee are determined and actuarially adjusted for individual
				or family coverage, rating areas, and age (in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
clauses (i)
				through (iii) of section 2701(a)(1)(A) of the Public Health Service Act

text.#text:
the employer
				contributions under such chapter on behalf of the

the employer
				contributions may be made directly to an Exchange for payment to an
				issuer.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Personnel Management

sections 5312 through 5316 of title 5, United States

Chief
				Administrative Officer of the House of

means an employee
				whose pay is disbursed by the

header.#text:
President, Vice
				President, political appointees, Members of Congress, and Congressional staff
				in the Exchange

Patient Protection and Affordable Care
			 Act

text.#text:

			 included in the enactment of the
